context.p: To install the JavaTM Platform, Standard Edition Development Kit (JDK):

step.cmd: Go to http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html and select Java Platform (JDK).
Select either Linux x86 or Linux x64 and whichever installer you prefer.
step.stepresult: The package you chose is downloaded.

step.cmd: Open a terminal window and type the following two commands:
step.stepresult: The first command protects the downloaded package from access. The second command installs the files to a directory labeled "jdk" and the current version.

step.cmd: Move the contents of the newly created jdk directory to /opt/packages/jdk. In the following example, the directory is labeled jdk1.6.0_20.

taskbody.postreq: For more information about installing the JDK, go to Java Platform Installation page.
